content:
Connector Class

In this Article

Represents a connector between two activity designers on a workflow design surface.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.DesignerSerializer(typeof(System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectorLayoutSerializer), typeof(System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializer))]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public class Connector : IDisposable

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • Connector

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

A connector is the line that appears on a workflow design surface that connects one activity designer to another. Connector provides methods and properties that allow you to customize how to draw a set of connectors when an activity designer is rendered at design time.

Constructors summary

Connector(ConnectionPoint,ConnectionPoint)

Initializes a new instance of the Connector class.

Properties summary

AccessibilityObject

Gets an AccessibleObject that accessibility applications use to adjust the application UI for users who have impairments.
Bounds

Gets the bounding rectangle for the connector on the workflow design surface.
ConnectorModified

Gets the value that indicates whether the Connector is modified.
ConnectorSegments

Gets a read-only collection of points that contains all segments found in the Connector.
ExcludedRoutingRectangles

Returns an empty array of Rectangle object. Derived classes populate this collection.
ParentDesigner

Gets the designer on which the connecter appears on the workflow design surface.
ParentView

Gets the workflow view associated with the connector.
Source

Gets or sets the ConnectionPoint where drawing of the Connector begins.
Target

Gets or sets the ConnectionPoint where drawing of the Connector ends.

Methods summary

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the current Connector is equal to the specified connector.
GetHashCode()

Returns the hash code for the current Connector.
GetService(Type)

Returns a service object of the specified type if it is available.
HitTest(Point)

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified point resides on the current Connector.
Invalidate()

Invalidates the current Connector and causes it to be redrawn.
Offset(Size)

Changes the Connector height and width using the settings defined in the specified Size.
OnLayout(ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs)

Notifies the Connector that layout operations are occurring.
OnPaint(ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs)

Renders the Connector on the workflow design surface.
OnPaintEdited(ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs,Point[],Point[])

Used for drawing the Connector when it is dragged from one state to another.
OnPaintSelected(ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs,Boolean,Point[])

Used for drawing a Connector that is selected by the user.
PerformLayout()

Performs layout tasks for the Connector.
SetConnectorSegments(ICollection<Point>)

Reroutes the connector from source to target if the connector has changed.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IDisposable.Dispose()

Releases all resources used by the Connector.

Constructors

  • Connector(ConnectionPoint,ConnectionPoint)

    Initializes a new instance of the Connector class.

    public Connector (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectionPoint source, System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectionPoint target);

    Parameters

    • source
      ConnectionPoint

      The ConnectionPoint where drawing for the Connector begins.

    • target
      ConnectionPoint

      The ConnectionPoint where drawing for the Connector ends.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      source or target contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Properties

  • AccessibilityObject

    Gets an AccessibleObject that accessibility applications use to adjust the application UI for users who have impairments.

    public virtual System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject AccessibilityObject { get; }

    Property Value

    • AccessibleObject

      An AccessibleObject that accessibility applications use to adjust the application UI for users who have impairments.

  • Bounds

    Gets the bounding rectangle for the connector on the workflow design surface.

    public System.Drawing.Rectangle Bounds { get; }

    Property Value

    • Rectangle

      The Rectangle that bounds the connector on the workflow design surface.

  • ConnectorModified

    Gets the value that indicates whether the Connector is modified.

    public bool ConnectorModified { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the connector is modified; otherwise false.

  • ConnectorSegments

    Gets a read-only collection of points that contains all segments found in the Connector.

    public virtual System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.Drawing.Point> ConnectorSegments { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlyCollection<Point>

      A Point read-only collection that contains all segments found in the Connector.

  • ExcludedRoutingRectangles

    Returns an empty array of Rectangle object. Derived classes populate this collection.

    protected virtual System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Drawing.Rectangle> ExcludedRoutingRectangles { get; }

    Property Value

    • ICollection<Rectangle>

      A generic collection of Rectangle objects.

  • ParentDesigner

    Gets the designer on which the connecter appears on the workflow design surface.

    public System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeformActivityDesigner ParentDesigner { get; }

    Property Value

    • FreeformActivityDesigner

      The FreeformActivityDesigner on which the connector appears on the workflow design surface.

  • ParentView

    Gets the workflow view associated with the connector.

    protected System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView ParentView { get; }

    Property Value

    • WorkflowView

      The WorkflowView that is associated with the connector.

    Remarks

    ParentView provides access to the workflow design surface on which the connector appears.

  • Source

    Gets or sets the ConnectionPoint where drawing of the Connector begins.

    public System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectionPoint Source { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ConnectionPoint

      The ConnectionPoint where drawing of the Connector begins.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      When setting this property the source stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectionPoint.AssociatedDesigner* does not match the target associated designer.

    • ArgumentNullException

      Source was set to a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

  • Target

    Gets or sets the ConnectionPoint where drawing of the Connector ends.

    public System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectionPoint Target { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ConnectionPoint

      The ConnectionPoint where drawing of the Connector ends.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      When setting this property the source stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectionPoint.AssociatedDesigner* does not match the target associated designer.

    • ArgumentNullException

      Target was set to a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Methods

  • Equals(Object)

    Determines whether the current Connector is equal to the specified connector.

    public override bool Equals (object obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      System.Object

      The Connector to compare with the current connector.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified connector is equal to the current Connector; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Equals verifies that both the Source and Target properties of the two connectors hold references to the same ConnectionPoint objects.

  • GetHashCode()

    Returns the hash code for the current Connector.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      A hash code for the current Connector.

  • GetService(Type)

    Returns a service object of the specified type if it is available.

    protected virtual object GetService (Type serviceType);

    Parameters

    • serviceType
      Type

      The Type of the service object to return.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      A service object of type serviceType or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if there is no service object of type serviceType.

    Remarks

    GetService returns the service object available through ParentDesigner.

  • HitTest(Point)

    Returns a value that indicates whether the specified point resides on the current Connector.

    public virtual bool HitTest (System.Drawing.Point point);

    Parameters

    • point
      Point

      The Point to test.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if point resides on the current Connector; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Typically, HitTest indicates whether a user has clicked a point on a connector displayed on a workflow design surface.

  • Invalidate()

    Invalidates the current Connector and causes it to be redrawn.

    public void Invalidate ();

    Remarks

    Invalidate causes all contents found in Bounds to be included in the update region for the ParentDesigner.

  • Offset(Size)

    Changes the Connector height and width using the settings defined in the specified Size.

    public virtual void Offset (System.Drawing.Size size);

    Parameters

    • size
      Size

      The Size that contains the height and width settings to offset the connector.

  • OnLayout(ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs)

    Notifies the Connector that layout operations are occurring.

    protected virtual void OnLayout (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs

      The ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs that contains the event data.

    Remarks

    OnLayout clears ConnectorSegments and repopulates it with a new range of points.

  • OnPaint(ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs)

    Renders the Connector on the workflow design surface.

    protected virtual void OnPaint (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs

      The ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs that contains the drawing data.

  • OnPaintEdited(ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs,Point[],Point[])

    Used for drawing the Connector when it is dragged from one state to another.

    protected virtual void OnPaintEdited (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs e, System.Drawing.Point[] segments, System.Drawing.Point[] segmentEditPoints);

    Parameters

    • e
      ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs

      An ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs object that specifies the graphics to use to draw the object and the clipping rectangle in which to draw it.

    • segments
      Point[]

      Coordinates for the segments in the Connector.

    • segmentEditPoints
      Point[]

      Coordinated for the edit points on the Connector.

    Remarks

    This method is called when a user is creating a connector, moving a middle point or moving an endpoint from one activity to another.

  • OnPaintSelected(ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs,Boolean,Point[])

    Used for drawing a Connector that is selected by the user.

    protected virtual void OnPaintSelected (System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs e, bool primarySelection, System.Drawing.Point[] segmentEditPoints);

    Parameters

    • e
      ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs

      An ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs object that specifies the graphics to use to draw the object and the clipping rectangle in which to draw it.

    • primarySelection
      Boolean

      Not used.

    • segmentEditPoints
      Point[]

      Coordinates for the edit points on the Connector.

  • PerformLayout()

    Performs layout tasks for the Connector.

    protected void PerformLayout ();

    Remarks

    PerformLayout calls the PerformLayout method and specifies that the layout update does not need to occur immediately.

  • SetConnectorSegments(ICollection<Point>)

    Reroutes the connector from source to target if the connector has changed.

    protected void SetConnectorSegments (System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Drawing.Point> segments);

    Parameters

    • segments
      ICollection<Point>

      A Point collection that represents the new connector segments to use for rerouting.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IDisposable.Dispose()

    Releases all resources used by the Connector.

    void IDisposable.Dispose ();
